column4: apparently it takes 3 years for the crop to be reused for indigenous seeds.

text: @Bhayankur Indigenous seeds aren't available anymore. Only the sterile GM seeds which can't be re-cultivated.
@Bhayankur America rewards their cotton farmers with unethical $3 bn subsides. Indian farmers can't compete with that sort of input waive.
@Bhayankur There is no other option but to use them. There aren't any other kind of seeds available anymore. Organic seeds are long dead.
@Bhayankur How does one break into 90% patent hegemony?
@Bhayankur It's not exactly drought but the upkeep for gm seeds that need way higher input costs for profitability.
@Bhayankur How do you link these to the soaring suicide rates in the cotton belt?
@Bhayankur A pack of 450 grams of Bt cotton seeds costs around 1650 of which roughly 1250 is for the patent/license. How is it justified?
